result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew John Reis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early Discharge at recommendation of Agent if obligations are fulfilled after 1 year.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

No violent or abusive contact with the victim.
Not to consume or possess alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.
Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent and AODA.

supervisions.notes: Early Discharge at recommendation of Agent if obligations are fulfilled after 1 year.

records.addlTxt:
8:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Grant D Scaife in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew John Reis in court.  Attorney Barry S. Cohen in court for Andrew John Reis. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights e-filed. 
Atty Cohen - proceed w/plea and sentencing today.
Deft pleads Guilty to Counts 3 & 4.
Court finds Deft Guilty on Counts 3 & 4, Counts 1 & 2 are Dismissed and Read in.
State: 2 years Probation with conditional Jail left to the Court's discretion and conditions as stated on the record.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
Victim in Court and makes statement. 
Atty Cohen makes sentencing argument and requests Court to impose not more than 20-30 days Jail with Huber, concurrent.
State does not have a recommendation if Deft is rejecting Probation and will leave to the Court.
Deft makes statement to Court.
Court orders 60 days Jail on Count 3 and 60 days Jail on Count 4 to run consecutive to Count 3. 
Court wants to be absolutely sure that Deft is rejecting Probation, Atty Cohen requests to speak w/Deft.
(Court goes off record)
09:37 AM  - Court recalls.
Atty Cohen spoke w/Deft and Deft will accept a Probation sentence and requests early termination of Probation after 1 year and that conditional jail be stayed.
Court orders 2 years Probation.

Defendant's Letters of Support

Defendant's AODA completion

Defense request Court leave bond as is, case is resolving.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Victim on phone and makes a statement to the Court.
Court will not increase bond at this time.
